div1.p: Narbona sends Hench information on the Hotel Varadero International.

div1.head: Letter from Oscar M. Narbona to Philip Showalter Hench, August 23, 1951
div1.opener:
HOTEL VARADERO
International VARADERO, CUBA.
August 23rd, 1951
Cuba
Executive Office
Has tent reservat
Jan 27 - Feb 3
for 4
will get for Feb 5
Mr. P. S. Hench, M. D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Mr. Hench:
div1.p:
It is with a great deal of pleasure and gratitude that we acknol-
edge your request for brochures and rates of our Hotel Varadero
Internacional.

Under separate cover we are forwarding to you one of our full
color Brochures. Enclose, please find our Tariff Schedule for
the two seasons.

Our rates are all European Plan because of our diversified
cuisine, and two different dining rooms. Our coffee shop prices
are comparable to the States. In the formal dining room where we
offer a floor show and two bands who play constantly for your en-
tertainment, the prices are slightly higher.

It would give us pleasure to receive your reservation. Will you
kindly advise us of the exact date of your intended arrival, the
lenght of your stay, and the accommodation you desire.

Every member of the Internacional staff and I will do our utmost
to assure you the most enjoyable vacation you have ever known.
We are looking forward to the pleasure of serving you.
div1.closer:
Cordially yours, HOTEL VARADERO INTERNACIONAL
Oscar M. Narbona
Manager OMN:lh
Enc.
Hoteles Internacional, S. A., William Liebow, President
